title: (x) Diane & Anthony elegant script - Citadel Script {Sebastian}
content:
Please help to identify these beautiful scripts. Thanks!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [whatfont1.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131107212118/http:/typophile.com/files/whatfont1.jpg) | 19.74 KB |
| [whatfont2.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131107212118/http:/typophile.com/files/whatfont2.jpg) | 20.49 KB |
author: tddots

comments.content:
#1 is what is known as a copperplate script. I don't know this exact face offhand, but here are a couple in the genre:

[Kuenstler Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20131107212118/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=LH.120929.0.2&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=Dianne+and+Anthony+&sampleSize=45)  
 [Palace Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20131107212118/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=M.6335.0.5&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=Dianne+and+Anthony&sampleSize=48)

#2 looks unfamiliar, but I would say it has a strong stylistic resemblance to [Nadine](http://web.archive.org/web/20131107212118/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/wiescherdesign/nadine/) from Wiescher Design.

- Mike Yanega
Thanks all of you for the great inputs. Please continue help to solve #2. Thanks!
I'm guessing if Mike couldn't ID it then it will be a tough one - he's the script pro around here.
